Statistics Module¶

This module provides functions for calculating basic sample statistics for any set of sample data and for quickly calculating statistics on a rolling sample taken from a incrementing time series (See Rolling Recursive Functions for more info). In addition, this module also provides functions for calculating fundamental financial statistics using Ito Calculus.

Rolling Recursive Functions¶

These functions assume sample statistics are calculated on a rolling sample taken from an incrementing time series. Each time period, the sample gains a new observation and loses its oldest observation. For example, at time t=0 we have the sample [1, 2, 3, 4] and then at time t=1 we lose the first sample of “1” and gain a sample of “5”, [2, 3, 4, 5]. These functions will calculate the new value of the given sample statistic in terms of its previous value, the new observation and the lost observation.

  1. def recursive_mean(xbar_previous, new_obs, lost_obs, n=settings.DEFAULT_ANALYSIS_PERIOD) :

    • [xbar_previous -> float] : Previous value of the sample mean

    • [new_obs -> float] : New sample observation

    • [lost_obs -> float] : Lost sample observation.

    • [n -> int] : Sample size. Defaults to the value set in the DEFAULT_ANALYSIS_PERIOD environment variable.

    • Description : Recursively calculates the current mean using the previous value of the sample mean, the new observation, the lost observation and the sample size.
